summary: This document is a collection of official count slips, inmate rosters, and out-count forms from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, dated August 6-7, 2019. It records routine inmate population counts and movements, including specific entries for inmates in the hospital or on suicide watch. The documents are standard Bureau of Prisons administrative forms.

persons.name: Torres
persons.context: Listed as an inmate in the hospital (HOSP) on the inmate roster dated 08-06-2019 with register number 85621-054.

persons.name: Bullock
persons.context: Listed as an inmate in the hospital (HOSP) on the inmate roster dated 08-07-2019 with register number 86409-054, with assignment noted as 'SUICIDE OR UNASSG'.

persons.name: Harrison
persons.context: Listed as an inmate with assignment 'TNWDVR' (Town Driver) on the inmate roster dated 08-07-2019 with register number 57084-056.

events.title: Daily Inmate Counts at MCC
events.description: Routine official inmate counts were conducted at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, with totals recorded at 762 inmates at 23:07 and 761 inmates at 03:01.

events.title: Daily Inmate Counts and Hospital/Suicide Watch
events.description: Routine official inmate counts continued, with totals of 763 and 761 recorded. An inmate named Bullock was listed in the hospital with an assignment noted as 'SUICIDE OR UNASSG'.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: These are standard Bureau of Prisons administrative records (count sheets, rosters, out-count forms) from the MCC in New York dated August 6-7, 2019.
The records show routine inmate population management, including counts by housing unit (e.g., B-A, C-A, Z-B).
Specific inmates are named in rosters: Torres (hospitalized), Bullock (hospitalized/suicide watch), and Harrison (town driver assignment).

The documents contain numerous blank signature and name fields for correctional officers preparing and taking counts, indicating these are unfilled templates or records where staff names are not legible/entered in the provided text.
The records are procedural and do not directly mention Jeffrey Epstein or any events related to his case, but date from the period of his incarceration at the MCC.
